drupalNodeEvent.title: Transnational Lives in Asia and the Pacific Colloquium

field_speakers.processed:
1. ‘Buying Benjamin in Batavia’
Jessica Hanser, University of British Columbia
2. ‘Gramophones and Ponies: Family Life in the Chinese Maritime Customs Service’
Donna Brunero, National University of Singapore
3. ‘White Wives in South China: Family, Mobility, and Emotion in the Archive’
Kate Bagnall, University of Tasmania
4. ‘A Lockdown Project: My quest for a Brothel Keeper and her Respectable Family in Twentieth-Century Britain, China, and Singapore’
Vivian Kong, University of Bristol

field_organizers.processed: HKBU Department of History and Modern History Research Centre
